top_comment.text:
Rick Santorum has a ridiculously small chance of winning in a general 
election. Why is he running again...﻿
top_comment.author: Komatsuzaki

comments.text:
+Alex Mondschein I'm sure he has some sense of a mission, but conservative 
social policies are not really appealing to non-conservatives. There is a 
difference between downplaying your opposition to same sex marriage, to 
simply stating it a few times (like Romney), and then to making it one of 
your core issues. I mean, does Santorum really expect to get votes with his 
incredibly vocal opposition to homosexuality and same sex marriage? 

 I too think that Romney will run again in 2016. It sounds like a joke to 
many a liberal and even conservative now, but he's simply the most 
qualified to fix the economy. I'm a big Romney fan boy. 

Jeb may be able to do a good job, but his last name just has too much 
baggage on it. Even if he were to be great, he won't win in a general 
election. Also, the fact that he's pretty much in favor of illegal 
immigration will turn off many conservatives. 

I'm not particularly fond of Bill, but I've gotta hand it to him for what 
he's done right. Unlike Obama, he was actually willing to compromise with 
Republicans. He may be a sexual predator and a liar, but at least he knew 
how to do the whole "president thing". 

I liked Ted Cruz before he went... kinda crazy. He's like the tea partier 
who gives no credit to conservatives. 

Rubio is certainly a possible prospect in the future. He could win many 
Hispanic votes for the GOP.

I was a kid during the Bush years, but I've read about it. He made a lot of 
decisions I don't like, such as Common Core. And I would like to know where 
he got his information that there were WMD's in the Middle East. I think he 
did the best he could, but his best, combined with some things he couldn't 
control, just amounted to a lackluster presidency.
comments.author: Komatsuzaki

comments.text:
He's a meglomaniac. He, literally, has *delusions* of grandeur. Not quite 
schizoid delusions, but still delusions. Even if the major donors don't 
fund him, the polls don't favor him, the networks don't support him, and 
the big guys won't endorse him... He truly and full-heartedly believes he 
can win. It's the God-complex (ironically, because God's supposed to be his 
homeboy.) he sees all things as possible, and he won't quit until he loses 
his marbles completely.
He's almost like Mitt Romney, I'm actually expecting Romney to run for the 
third time in 3 elections, and if that doesn't happen, he's young enough 
that I'm sure he plans on being president at *some* point in his life. But 
at least that's not a total pipe dream, Romney's gotten relatively close 
twice... And he does (unlike Santorum) have a solid backing of donors, 
endorsements, and support from the party. He fits the "2016 and beyond" 
mold for the Republicans.. Social "moderate", extreme fiscal conservative, 
from a blue state. Actually I think he's (despite being a 2 time loser) 
their best bet since Giuliani quit, Christie (who was by all means going to 
be handed the nomination) is immersed in scandal, and I just can not see 
them putting up another fucking Bush... Even if Jeb is "the better Bush", 
that name is so tainted... I think that would be a *huge* mistake. If it 
came down to Jeb vs. Hillary, it's going to automatically be comparing 
Bill's presidency to Bush's presidency.. If I'm Hillary, I'd rather 
independents look at Bill's presidency than Obama's... And if I'm a 
Republican I want to pretend Bush's presidency never happened. I mean party 
politics aside, I think even Republicans can admit 2004-2012 was a 
*trainwreck*. Terrorist attacks, two failed wars, the worst recession in 
the history of recessions, Bill left a record surplus, Bush turned it into 
a record shortage, the Patriot Act, No Child Left Behind... I mean, dude, 
everything he did failed. That's unheard of, other presidents, from both 
parties did some good/some bad.. Nobody's ever done no good, all bad. He'll 
go down in History as the single worst president quite posdibly ever. I 
know that's a hefty statement, but you have to way, way, way back to find 
anyone even close to that level. Sorry for rambling, I got carried away, 
but yeah I wouldn't be surprised to see Romney give it another go. The 
choices to take on Hillary are all losers... It's Bush, Christie (too much 
dirt), Rubio (Right now I see him as the front runner, but his party 
doesn't see him as a contendor.. I don't think he'll get the backing Bush, 
Christie or Romney would), Cruz (joke), Santorum (joke), Paul (polarizing, 
real Republicans don't trust him) and Carson (joke)... Somebody's gotta 
step in, and Romney will jump at the chance.
comments.author: Alex Mondschein
